Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop

Interface ClientHandler

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    HTTPClientHandler, LDAPConnectionReady, RedisConnectionReady, ServerGreeting
    public interface ClientHandler
    Base interface for handling client-side connection lifecycle events. This interface defines the fundamental TCP connection events that all client protocol implementations must handle.

    Client handlers are event-driven and asynchronous, responding to network events delivered by the underlying Connection. Protocol-specific subinterfaces extend this base interface to add protocol-specific events and behaviours.

    All handler methods are called from the Connection's executor thread and should not perform blocking operations. Long-running or blocking operations should be delegated to separate threads.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    Client.connect(ClientHandler), ConnectionInfo, TLSInfo

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • onConnected

        void onConnected​(ConnectionInfo info)
        Called when the TCP connection has been successfully established.

        This method is invoked after the socket connection completes and any SSL handshake (if applicable) has finished successfully. The connection is ready for protocol-specific communication.

        The ConnectionInfo parameter provides details about the connection including:

        • Local and remote socket addresses
        • Whether the connection is secure (TLS)
        • TLS details if secure (protocol, cipher, certificates)

        Protocol implementations typically use this event to initiate the protocol handshake or send initial commands.

        Parameters:
        info - details about the established connection

      • onError

        void onError​(java.lang.Exception cause)
        Called when a connection or protocol error occurs.

        This method is invoked for various error conditions including:

        • TCP connection failures (host unreachable, connection refused)
        • SSL handshake failures
        • Network I/O errors during operation
        • Protocol-specific error conditions

        After this method is called, the connection should be considered unusable and will be cleaned up automatically.

        Parameters:
        cause - the exception that caused the error condition

      • onDisconnected

        void onDisconnected()
        Called when the remote peer has closed the connection.

        This method is invoked when the remote end closes the TCP connection gracefully. It provides an opportunity for cleanup and final processing before the connection resources are released.

        Protocol implementations can use this event to update statistics, log completion status, or trigger reconnection logic if appropriate.

      • onTLSStarted

        void onTLSStarted​(TLSInfo info)
        Called when a TLS upgrade has been successfully completed.

        This method is invoked after a successful STARTTLS command response and the completion of the TLS handshake. The connection is now secure and all subsequent communication will be encrypted.

        The TLSInfo parameter provides details about the TLS session:

        • Protocol version (TLSv1.2, TLSv1.3)
        • Cipher suite
        • Peer and local certificates
        • Whether session resumption was used
        • ALPN negotiated protocol

        Protocol implementations can use this event to:

        • Reset protocol state (as required by some protocols like SMTP)
        • Re-issue capabilities or handshake commands
        • Update security-related state or configuration
        • Log security upgrade events
        Parameters:
        info - details about the TLS session
